channel.title: Distrelec Jira
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6747] Show next and prev links to Google bot only
item.description:
We had this language switch problem in ticket DISTRELEC-6093. By hiding the "alternate" links for normal customers (and showing them only to SearchBots) we were able to eliminate the problem.

In ticket DISTRELEC-6307 we introduced paging links which are only used by search bots. Although these links should not display links to another language, I want hide them for normal customers, too.

<link rel="next" href=...>
<link rel="pref" href=...>
item.summary: Show next and prev links to Google bot only

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: @Pierre: Can I move the links to the section that will be visible to SearchBots only?

Yes we can !

Can you just provide the list of the Bots UA concerned ? (to be sure we don't exlude anything ?)
Thank you.

Search bots are those having the following string as part of the UA: (configured in /distrelecB2Bstorefront/web/webroot/WEB-INF/config/spring-mvc-config.xml)

	<util:list id="searchRobotUserAgents" value-type="java.lang.String">
		<value>adidxbot</value>
		<value>AdsBot-Google</value>
		<value>AhrefsBot</value>
		<value>archive.org_bot</value>
		<value>Baiduspider</value>
		<value>bingbot</value>
		<value>facebookexternalhit</value>
		<value>Exabot</value>
		<value>GomezAgent</value>
		<value>Googlebot</value>
		<value>rogerbot-crawler</value>
		<value>Sogou web spider</value>
		<value>ca-crawler</value>
		<value>YandexBot</value>
		<value>YandexImages</value>
		<value>Yahoo! Slurp</value>
	</util:list>

@Adrian :
Can you add in this list

  • "Mediapartners-Google"
  • "Googlebot-Image"

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6734] All Additional filters are open incorrectly
item.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. http://test.distrelec.ch/search?q=test
2. Auto-update results must be OFF
3. Click "Add additional filter", select one, and perform a filter with any of its attributes.
4. Remove the filter in the top Filter box.
5. Click "Add additional filter", and select one.

Expected:
Only the selected additional filter must be opened.

Issue:
All additional filters open, one after another.
item.summary: All Additional filters are open incorrectly

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Please test after the next deployment.

NOTE: Correct fix version v3.3.3
Rafael Burlet | Distrelec...can you change the fix version please?
Laura, please test tomorrow after the q-deployment, thx.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6729] Language change after ajax reload
item.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Open http://test.distrelec.ch/search?q=test, in Tab1 (Lang: DE)
2. Open http://test.distrelec.ch in Tab2
3. Change language to EN in Tab2
4. Go back to Tab1, and apply some filters. It will trigger an ajax call to reload the search results.

Issue: Some parts of the site are in EN, and some others in DE.

Solution
add an new parameter, the language, to the request ajax call . In this case, we ensure that we get the result in the page language.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: I suggest to add an new parameter, the language, to the request ajax call . In this case, we ensure that we get the result in the page language.
Hi Surendra, please implement according to nabil, If you need more information, please align with him, thx.
Please review in next version.

Hi Surendra,

Your solution fixed the problem, but now we have a problem with the Auto Apply filter.

please double check with me any change you do in the Front End.
Thanks
Let's try the Ajax solution proposed by Nabil

Currently, we are sending this query URL from the Front End (productlist.js, function onLoadProductsForFacetSearch)

"/search?q=test&filter_Analogausgang=%2B&page=1&pageSize=10"

Could you modify the Back end to accept a Language parameter? Something like this:

"/search?q=test&filter_Analogausgang=%2B&page=1&pageSize=10&lang=EN"
please review.
Please test after the next deployment

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6728] Filtering issue when filters are not complementary
item.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. http://test.distrelec.ch/search?q=test
2. Set Auto-Apply filter OFF
3. Click the filters: Farbe->blau and Farbe->schwarz
4. Click on Reload Search Result
5. Click the filter: Länge->600mm
6. Click on Reload Search Result

Number of filter selected in the Filter Box should be the same as filters checkboxes selected.
But there is one filter which is not removed in the Filter box

See image -> http://snag.gy/iBAXZ.jpg
item.summary: Filtering issue when filters are not complementary

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please test after the next deployment

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6698] Optimize FF export - reduce fetch time
item.description:
In ticket DISTRELEC-6673 I saw another optimization opportunity.
Query time (time to receive first record) is around 1/3 of the whole execution time. Hence the fetch time (receiving the whole rest) takes 2/3 (=around 2 hours).
By eliminating the sub-queries (in the select clause) the fetch time can further be reduced.
item.summary: Optimize FF export - reduce fetch time

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Timing of the job distrelec_7310_ch_de_export on Q-System (while a PIM import was running all the time)

3h05 No optimization (using distff.distFactFinderProductExportQueryCreator2)
2h57 Field Replacement: Calculate data for all products at once instead of using a sub-select
2h40 Remove the three MediaURLs from the export since they all use sub-selects (do not export the fields: ImageURL, AdditionalImageURLs and ManufacturerImageURL)
2h40 Additionally remove the field PromotionLabels

Eliminating sub-selects did not reduced the export time as expected.
However, after removing the ORDER BY clause the export was much faster (around 40min for distrelec_7310_ch_de_export on Q-System).
I have attached a patch file in case we want to calculate the "Replacement" column using a JOIN instead of a SUB-SELECT. (see ReplacementAsJoinInsteadOfSubselect.patch)

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6548] SEO - Duplication Issues - Category level with only one product
item.description:
Observations :

  • This category contain only one product : http://www.distrelec.ch/en/*/c/cat-671902
  • This case happen in 26% of the categories (10k per lang, so 30k for ch) (verified by a crawl, sample),
  • A category is supposed to contain multiple products,
  • The products inside a category can fluctuate and create a "1 product category",
  • A category can be created with only one product by category managers,

Impacts :

  • UX side, it's a useless step for a user browsing the website.
  • SEO side, this create a huge amount of duplicated categories, which is killing the entire process of indexation and ranking.

Demands :

  • Redirect in 301 categories with only one product inside to this product (same process as the search results with only one results).
    Example : http://www.distrelec.ch/en/*/c/cat-671902 =301> http://www.distrelec.ch/en/*/p/30011702
  • If this functionality create a blocking issue for the UX side, implement it only for robots.

Checking process :

  • Need to be verify locally by PHUBERT
  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.
item.summary: SEO - Duplication Issues - Category level with only one product

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: As seen with Daniela, it's not a bottleneck on UX side to redirect since this category pages are accessible only from the product breadcrumb.
As seen with Jean-Wilfried, a full review of the entire data model concerning PIM/Hybris categories should be the natural next step since this tiquet is just a fallback.
Please estimate, thx.

fixed

will be in the next Q deployment.
Please test today, thx.

• Test on Q : NOK, not ready for P
    It work correctly in the case of my list but sometime the redirection behave strangely one other 1 products cat:
    Exemple :
    On Thermal Imaging Cameras category the 1 product categories (1, 2, 3) lead to this non related product url

Was an issue with the fact-finder query parameters.

fixed!

I tried It again on Q but it's still not working .
Is it still on your dev branch ?

Deployment to Q (v3.3.2) is not yet done.
Will is on it right now, I guess Rafael will inform you a soon as the deployment is done.
Please test on Q, thx.

@ Rene : The redirections to the right product are operational.
Only issue, it's in 302, please replace it by a http 301.
I'm doing a bling crawl to see if I find other issues.
Fixed and checked in to v3.3

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5960] SEO - Fluctuation Issues - Empty Category/Manufacturer Pages Issues - 0 results to redirect in 301 to upper hierarchy level
item.description:
Observations :

  • There is a fluctuation of our assortment of products over time.
  • This product fluctuation affect the active category pages.
  • Manual maintenance on PIM also create a fluctuation on category pages.
  • This result into 15 to 20% of accessible category pages inside hybris with 0 results category pages. (10% on /c/cat-D* pattern, 20 % on /c/cat-numericID pattern)
  • Google have & is crawling and indexing those pages.
  • Those pages have and will accumulate over time "seo weight".

Impacts :

  • Google is wasting crawl time on 0 content pages.
  • Over the time this number is going to grow.
  • No SEO correction = Destroying the accumulated seo weight of those previously content filled pages.
  • No SEO correction is an equivalent of a failed SEO migration

Demands :

  • Redirect in 301 the 0 results category/manufaturer pages to there upper category/level.
    • Exemple 1 :
      This empty category page :
      http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Komponenten/Relais-%26-Schalter/Ger%C3%A4teschalter/Industrie-Kippschalter/Miniatur-Kippschalter/Zubeh%C3%B6r/c/cat-DC-21695
      Must be redirect in 301 to the upper category level :
      http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Komponenten/Relais-%26-Schalter/Ger%C3%A4teschalter/Industrie-Kippschalter/Miniatur-Kippschalter/c/cat-DC-1101
    • Exemple 2 :
      This empty manufacturer page :
      http://www.distrelec.ch/fr/manufacturer/kabeltronik/man_kbl
      Must be redirect in 301 to the manufacturers page :
      http://www.distrelec.ch/fr/manufacturer/

Checking process :

  • Need to be verify locally by PHUBERT
  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.
item.summary: SEO - Fluctuation Issues - Empty Category/Manufacturer Pages Issues - 0 results to redirect in 301 to upper hierarchy level

status.description: This issue was once resolved, but the resolution was deemed incorrect. From here issues are either marked assigned or resolved.

comments.comment: As we discussed with Francesco, It is not possible to do this. Hence I m forwarding it to you.
I will check with PIM if something is doable.
@Francesco : If I'm providing inside PIM import a column for every category with a redirection id to use, is it more doable like this ?

The issue has been solved implementing this logic.

The redirection works only for search bots
The redirection is done recursively until a category with at least one product is found. Or until the root category.

All the other cases will work as usual.

It's very important to know that the check of the number of products is peformed through the factfinder index. This means speed.
But, on the other hand, we have to wait until the fact finder export is done, and the FF system is then aware of the status of the category structure.

Great news, thank you Francesco.
When will it be deploy on Q ?

We're going to deploy now the new release v3.2.m0
Tomorrow you can test.

(http://test.distrelec.ch/de/*/c/cat-DC-21695 is not redirected anywhere)

sorry, i haven't informed you that this redirection is working only for Web Crawlers bots.

From my point of view it's ready for P.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6581] FF - missing facets / 0-value transmitted by FF
item.description:
As discussed with Will, I looked into the case of Beat Eugsters Frequenzumrichter search (see attached):

When I did the first search, the Nennleistung did not appear as a filter (see screenshots). I checked in the FF UI and there the filter was there. However, in the XML, it seems to be transmitted with a null-value.
I tried to navigate one level lower and chose the next category level "Frequenzumrichter" - here I get the Nennleistung, but I have the same null-value in the FF-XML.

I thought it had to do with a setting that technical facets are only coming on category 3 level (I suppose that's what Beat means with "Filterunterdrückung"). So I removed this dependency and cleared the cache. The filter appeared from the beginning of the search - null-value still in FF.

Then I reactivated the category 3 dependency again, cleared the cache, and the Nennleistung was also there, FF-XML is still null-value.

Conclusion: It has nothing to do with the category 3 level dependency. There seems to be an issue with the FF-XML, as it's constantly transferring a null-value, even when the shop is displaying values. Also, there seems to be some kind of time-out or cache thing, cause in some cases it works, in others it does not - and dependent on which one you "start" with, you either always see the filter or not.

FF-search: http://10.191.20.145:8080/FACT-Finder-hybris/AdminMode.ff?sid=184F91954353AE4EE45DBCED265818A6&uid=-675716761&cid=&site=demoshop&sourceRefKey=mjbRC20j4&productsPerPage=6&channel=distrelec_P_7310_ch_de&query=frequenzumrichter&x=45&y=24
item.summary: FF - missing facets / 0-value transmitted by FF

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

comments.comment: Please investigate and assign back to me with estimation to fix if needed.
High level estimate: 6h

A part of the problem has already been fixed yesterday in a call with FF. You can get some discrepancies between the "shop" view and the "config" view in the search when you have a minimum percentage to display facets. This has been lowered again, so this should not have a massive impact anymore. However, the specific Frequenzumrichter case has not been fixed, unfortunately.

Hi Daniela

If something is wrong in the FF xml and its not a data problem (missing data from hybris) then we need to check with Mr. Türk, because its only a FF problem.

WAITING FOR ANSWER FROM MR. TÜRK

Hallo Herr Spalinger,
ich habe den Customization-Code überprüft und konnte keinen Fehler feststellen. Sofern keine Unit vorliegt, wird der Gruppenname unverändert als Name im Drop-Down-Gruppenlement übernommen. Andernfalls wird der Name vor der Doppel-Tilde extrahiert und zusätzlich die Einheit in der Gruppe platziert.

Beste Grüße
Gebriyel Türk
FACT-Finder Project Development

Cheers
Will

/Daniela

<group name="Betriebsspannung" detailedLinks="5" style="MULTISELECT" refKey="null">...</group>
<group name="Verfügbarkeit" detailedLinks="3" style="MULTISELECT" refKey="null">...</group>
</asn>
<paging pageCount="7" currentPage="1" productsPerPage="50">...</paging>
<sorting>...</sorting>
<results count="314">...</results>
<refKey>5VYq02VdU</refKey>
</ff>

search for "frequenzumrichter" in shop:
http://jira.distrelec.com/secure/attachment/17786/Nennleistung_nicht_in_shop_08042015.jpg

--> but the filter nennleistung is missing in the shop. and some filters which are visible in the shop are not visible in FF UI. why do we have different filters for the same search query and the same resultset of 314 products?

Q-SYSTEM
same resultset and same filters for the search query "frequenzumrichter". works fine here:

<ff xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="ffresult.xsd">
<searchStatus>resultsFound</searchStatus>
<articleNumberSearchStatus>noArticleNumberSearch</articleNumberSearchStatus>
<searchTimedOut>false</searchTimedOut>
<productsPerPageOptions default="50" selected="50">...</productsPerPageOptions>
<searchControlParams>...</searchControlParams>
<searchParams>...</searchParams>
<breadCrumbTrail>...</breadCrumbTrail>
<asn>
<group name="Kategorien" detailedLinks="5" style="TREE" refKey="null">...</group>
<group name="Nennleistung" detailedLinks="5" style="MULTISELECT" refKey="null">...</group>
<group name="Eingangsfrequenz" detailedLinks="5" style="MULTISELECT" refKey="null">...</group>
<group name="Relaisausgang" detailedLinks="5" style="MULTISELECT" refKey="null">...</group>
<group name="Startmoment" detailedLinks="5" style="MULTISELECT" refKey="null">...</group>
<group name="Taktfrequenz" detailedLinks="5" style="MULTISELECT" refKey="null">...</group>
<group name="Überlast" detailedLinks="5" style="MULTISELECT" refKey="null">...</group>
<group name="Abmessungen B x H x T" detailedLinks="5" style="MULTISELECT" refKey="null">...</group>
<group name="Ausgangsfrequenz" detailedLinks="5" style="MULTISELECT" refKey="null">...</group>
<group name="Analogausgang" detailedLinks="5" style="MULTISELECT" refKey="null">...</group>
<group name="Ausführung" detailedLinks="5" style="MULTISELECT" refKey="null">...</group>
<group name="Analogeingang" detailedLinks="5" style="MULTISELECT" refKey="null">...</group>
<group name="Betriebstemperatur" detailedLinks="5" style="MULTISELECT" refKey="null">...</group>
<group name="Digitalausgang" detailedLinks="5" style="MULTISELECT" refKey="null">...</group>
<group name="Betriebsspannung" detailedLinks="5" style="MULTISELECT" refKey="null">...</group>
<group name="Digitaleingang" detailedLinks="5" style="MULTISELECT" refKey="null">...</group>
<group name="Nennstrom" detailedLinks="5" style="MULTISELECT" refKey="null">...</group>
<group name="Betriebsspannungsart" detailedLinks="5" style="MULTISELECT" refKey="null">...</group>
<group name="Hersteller" detailedLinks="5" style="MULTISELECT" refKey="null">...</group>
<group name="Verfügbarkeit" detailedLinks="3" style="MULTISELECT" refKey="null">...</group>
</asn>
<paging pageCount="7" currentPage="1" productsPerPage="50">...</paging>
<sorting>...</sorting>
<results count="314">...</results>
<refKey>Nhd3fXAIm</refKey>
</ff>

Shop: http://jira.distrelec.com/secure/attachment/17788/Same_filters_on_Q-system.jpg
FF customer support ticket opened. Waiting for an answer. Ticket#2015040811000108

Guten Tag Herr Spalinger,

wir haben in der Zwischenzeit Zugang zu den Systemen erhalten. Vielen Dank dafür.

Wie schon erwähnt liefern die einzelnen Instanzen teilweise unterschiedliche Attribute als ASN Gruppen zurück. Dies sollte eigentlich nicht geschehen, da alle Instanzen, wie ich das gesehen habe, die gleichen Resourcen nutzen.
Die Unterschiede könnten, meiner Meinung nach, durch eine Anpassung verursacht werden, die für sie geschrieben wurde. Der Entwickler ist morgen wieder im Haus, so dass ich ihn bitten würde, einen Blick drauf zu werfen.

Mit neuen Erkenntnissen werde ich mich dann wieder melden.

Beste Grüße,
Rudolf Meier
FACT-Finder Support

Hallo Herr Tasdemir,
mit den zusätzlichen Channels ist die Konfiguration /data_nfs/env-hp-p/factfinder/ff-resources/FACT-Finder-hybris/conf/fff.properties nun zu aktualisieren:
Die Gesamtzahl der Libraries sollte der Anzahl eingerichteter Channels x 2 (1x Suggest und 1x Suche) entsprechen. Sofern einzelne Channels in ihrer config.

{CHANNEL}

.xml einen libraryCount explizit aufweisen, ist der Unterschied zum Default-LibraryCount von 1, hinzu zu addieren.
Der Total-Library-Count wird über die Property "libraryCount" festgelegt und lautet derzeit auf 50. D.h. eine Ausweitung auf über 70 wäre naheliegend. Zusätzlich ist hierbei auch der LibraryCount der Zusatz-Datenbank zu berücksichtigen und dieser auf die Anzahl verfügbarer Channels zu erhöhen mit folgender Property, die aktuell 5 aufweist: SearchCallback.databaseLibraryCount
Nach dem Tomcat-Neustart wäre die Exklusivität der Libraries je Channel wieder gegeben. Zusätzlich müsste jedoch sichergestellt werden, dass genügend CPU-Kerne vorliegen. Wir empfehlen je Library einen CPU-Kern, damit der Durchsatz hoch und Wartezeiten für Requests gering ausfallen.
Wir verwenden in unseren Clustern Intel Xeon CPU E3-1230 V2 mit vier Kernen (3.30GHz) und Hyperthreading sowie bis zu 128 GB RAM. Solch ein Setup reicht für 1 Million initiale Suchanfragen pro Monat vollkommen aus. Da Sie etwa 3 Millionen initiale Anfragen pro Monat bedienen, sind folglich mindestens 3 Suchserver mit 8 logischen CPU-Kernen und der genannten Taktung zu empfehlen. Der benötigte Speicherbedarf resultiert aus der DB-Größe zu Suggest und Suche multipliziert mit der Anzahl verwendeter Libraries.
Bedingt durch das eingesetzte NFS-Dateisystem betragen die Ladezeiten neuer Suchindizes je Channel bis zu 2 Minuten. Während des Ladevorgangs stauen sich die Requests auf und es kann Shop-seitig zu Timeouts kommen. Besteht die Möglichkeit, den Durchsatz im Netzlaufwerk zu erhöhen um die Ladezeiten zu reduzieren?
Schon jetzt danke für eine kurze Rückmeldung.

Beste Grüße
Gebriyel Türk
FACT-Finder Project Development

Hallo Herr Spalinger,

die Ursache konnte bislang nicht ermittelt werden. Ich gehe jedoch davon aus, dass die zusätzlichen Dateien, welche für die Facetten-Sortierung/-Anzeige verwendet werden, auf den verschiedenen Servern zur Laufzeit nicht übereinstimmend im Speicher vorliegen. Daher finden Sie im Mailanhang eine angepasste Version der Customizations vor, welche Details nach erfolgreichem Ladevorgang der Zusatzdateien - im Rahmen einer Warn-Meldung - im App-Logfile schreibt.

Könnten Sie bitte diese Datei deployen und zusätzlich überprüfen, wieso die Importe seitens des Shopsystems nicht ausgelöst werden?

Vielen Dank.

Best regards,
Gebriyel Türk
FACT-Finder Support

Dear Daniela, dear David,

The 3 tickets from below are going on for some weeks now. I need to set up a deadline for when they will be ready. Please give me an estimate.

DISTRELEC-6581 - FF - missing facets / 0-value transmitted by FF
DISTRELEC-6444 - Multiple selections end up in error when filters not automated / numeric fields in all channels
DISTRELEC-6524 - Remove/Deactivate any lookup and sorting logic for facets in the shop

Thank you in advance,
Regards,
Oana

--> Please estimate and inform Oana accordingly

Thanks
/Daniela

The FF support ticket is still open. I cant estimate how long they have to fix it. Next step from our side is to deploy the new JAR file on all FF nodes this evening.

Hallo Herr Spalinger,

der symbolische Link /data_nfs/env-hp-p/factfinder/ff-resources/FACT-Finder-hybris/customClasses/distrelec-customClasses-current.jar ist auf die neue JAR-Datei (/data_nfs/env-hp-p/factfinder/ff-resources/FACT-Finder-hybris/customClasses/distrelec-customClasses-1.1.44.jar) umzustellen und die Datei im Ordner /data_nfs/env-hp-p/factfinder/ff-resources/FACT-Finder-hybris/customClasses abzulegen. Danach ist der Tocmat-Service auf allen Servern neuzustarten.

Vielen Dank und Beste Grüße
Gebriyel Türk
FACT-Finder Support

Hallo Herr Spalinger,

vielen Dank für das Deployment. Ich konnte es nun soweit eingrenzen, dass es nicht an den Customizations zur Suche liegt. Ich melde mich nochmal bei Ihnen, sobald ich näheres zur Fehlerursache weiß.

Beste Grüße
Gebriyel Türk
FACT-Finder Support

Guten Morgen Herr Spalinger,
bitte deployen Sie diese Updates in folgender Reihenfolge, damit das Facetten-Problem gelöst werden kann:
• Symlinks zu den JAR-Dateien unter /data_nfs/env-hp-p/factfinder/ff-resources/FACT-Finder-hybris/customClasses
o distrelec-customClasses-current.jar
o fff-commonClasses-current.jar
• Symlink zur WAR-Datei /var/lib/tomcat6/webapps mit Ziel-Datei unter /usr/share/tomcat6/ff-builds
o FACT-Finder-hybris.war
Bitte stellen Sie hierbei sicher, dass der Ordner FACT-Finder-hybris aus dem Webapps-Verzeichnis automatisch vollständig gelöscht wird, bevor der gelöschte Symlink wiederhergestellt und das Deployment der neuen WAR-Datei ausgelöst wird.
Die neuen JAR-Dateien werden benötigt, da diese auf die neueste FACT-Finder 6.9 Revision abgestimmt sind. Alle Dateien liegen unter https://share.omikron.net/index.php/s/d8bc0b831efb8c73f38a49ae6ba34598 (Passwort: ffdistrelec) zum Download bereit.
Nachdem der Login-Screen im Bereich des Footer die neue Version ausweist und unter Benachrichtigungen > Systemübersicht die neuen Customization-Versionen aufgeführt sind, sollte der Tomcat-Service neugestartet werden.
Bitte informieren Sie mich nach dem erfolgreichen Deployment im Q-System.
Vielen Dank.
Beste Grüße
Gebriyel Türk
FACT-Finder Project Development

Hallo Herr Türk

Das Deployment der neuen JAR / WAR Files im Q System ist durch. Sie können nun mit Ihren Tests beginnen.

Beste Grüsse
W. Spalinger

Hallo Herr Spalinger,
da im Q-System die Facetten nun auf allen Servern übereinstimmen, möchte ich Sie bitten, u.g. Updates im P-System vorzunehmen.
Vielen Dank.

Beste Grüße
Gebriyel Türk
FACT-Finder Project Development
